metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3253 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The MethodClosure class in runtime/MethodClosure.java in Apache Groovy 1.7.0 through 2.4.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service via a crafted serialized object.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3253` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

groovy2 - 2.5.4-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ebarretto> groovy in Xenial is currently FTBFS. Also there's no more support from upstream to that version (1.8.6)

criterions.comment: groovy: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
groovy2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.4-1').
